conclusion: For an ideal gas at constant amount, V ∝ T / p.
Segment BC is a straight line whose extrapolated extension passes through the origin (0, 0).
The slope of line BC is V / T = constant = V_B / T_B.
At B we have V_B = 2 V₀ and T_B = T₀.
Point C lies on the same straight line, so V_C / T_C = 2 V₀ / T₀.
V₀ / T_C = 2 V₀ / T₀ implies T_C = T₀ / 2.
The temperature of the gas in state C is TC = ½ T₀.
